definition: Shanhai Pass in Hebei, at the eastern terminus of the Ming dynasty Great Wall/Shanhaiguan district of Qinhuangdao city 秦皇島市|秦皇岛市[Qin2 huang2 dao3 shi4], Hebei
surname Shan
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous
surname Hai
mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve
surname Guan
Shanhaiguan district of Qinhuangdao city 秦皇島市|秦皇岛市[Qin2 huang2 dao3 shi4], Hebei

sentences.english: In 2001 Shanhaiguan Pass district won the title of national historical and cultural town.
sentences.chinese: 2001年，山海关区又荣膺国家历史文化名城称号。

sentences.english: "Pass" of Shanhaiguan. This fort is near the eastern edges of the Great Wall.
sentences.chinese: 山海关的“通道”位于长城东部边缘附近。

sentences.english: The Great Wall begins in the east from the Shanghaiguan Pass and ends at the Jiayuguan Pass in the west.
sentences.chinese: 长城东起山海关，西至嘉峪关。

sentences.english: We’ll be coming into Shanghaiguan in a few minutes.
sentences.chinese: 再过几分钟我们就要到山海关了。

sentences.english: The third part mainly is the elaboration of Shanhaiguan history and the development.
sentences.chinese: 第三部分主要是山海关历史及其发展的论述。

sentences.english: The Great Wall east to Shanhaiguan, West to Gansu and east to Jiayuguan, the Yalu River.
sentences.chinese: 长城东起山海关，西至甘肃嘉峪关，东至鸭绿江。

sentences.english: Shanhaiguan three-dimensional traffic conditions are very favorable sea and air.
sentences.chinese: 山海关海陆空立体交通条件十分优越。

sentences.english: This is the second time the East Emperor Kangxi, when the customs officials who patrol the poem written.
sentences.chinese: 这是康熙皇帝第二次东巡山海关时写下的诗句。

sentences.english: Enemy attack Shanhaiguan, East Rochester is a line of defense.
sentences.chinese: 敌人进攻山海关，东罗城又是一道防线。

sentences.english: Cape Mount towering mountains, rolling, is a natural barrier Shanhaiguan.
sentences.chinese: 角山山势巍峨，绵延起伏，是山海关的天然屏障。

definition: Juyongguan, frontier fortress on Great Wall north of Beijing, in Changping district 昌平區|昌平区[Chang1 ping2 qu1]
Jinzhou prefecture-level city in Liaoning province 遼寧省|辽宁省 in northeast China
beyond the pass, i.e. the region north and east of Shanhai Pass 山海關|山海关[Shan1 hai3 guan1] or the region west of Jiayu Pass 嘉峪關|嘉峪关[Jia1 yu4 guan1] or both

Rehe, Qing dynasty province abolished in 1955 and divided among Hebei, Liaoning and Inner Mongolia/refers to the Qing imperial resort at Chengde/see also 避暑山莊|避暑山庄[bi4 shu3 shan1 zhuang1] (history)

defensive fort over border post
Wu Sangui (1612-1678), Chinese general who let the Manchus into China and helped them establish the Qing Dynasty, later leading a revolt against Qing in an effort to start his own dynasty
Taku Forts, maritime defense works in Tianjin dating back to the Ming dynasty, playing a prominent role during the Opium Wars (1839-1860)
